issue.title: build(deps): bump oqs-sys/liboqs from `b3b0fbb` to `352cd05`

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: submodules
labels.description: Pull requests that update Submodules code

issue.body:
Bumps [oqs-sys/liboqs](https://github.com/Open-Quantum-Safe/liboqs) from `b3b0fbb` to `352cd05`.
Commits
  • 352cd05 build: set folder as ./build/test when using VS (#1557)
  • 007219c ci: github actions CI for Windows x86 and x64 (#1554)
  • e6c650c Document Falcon constant time errors (#1552)
  • b8a0bc7 Add Windows ARM64 support (#1545)
  • cc313b2 Add CI for apple mobile platforms (#1546)
  • f761b06 Pull Neon implementation of Falcon from PQClean (#1547)
  • 7ef422a Update Classic McEliece suppression files (#1541)
  • 456015c Bump gitpython from 3.1.34 to 3.1.35 in /scripts/copy_from_upstream (#1551)
  • See full diff in compare view

You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

comment.body: This is blocked on OpenSSL getting fixed in the CI runners

issue.title: cmake Issues building with an existing OpenSSL build: liboqs_DiR ?
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
cmake Issues building with an existing OpenSSL build

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
I am trying to build openssl, liboqs & oqs-provider from scratch.
Fedora 39. Both clang and gcc installed
Configuring in visual studio code using make, cmake, c/c++ plugins

source is under /home/jonesn/src

1. Build openSSL
* `./Configure --prefix=/home/jonesn/opt/openssl --openssldir=/home/jonesn/usr/local/ssl `
* `make`
* Observe: libssl.a & libcrypto.a are in the top level source directory (no specific build output directory), whilst shared library versions such as libcrypto.so & libssl.so are in /home/jonesn/opt/ssl/lib

2. Build liboqs
* Configure cmake with `-DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Debug -DOPENSSL_ROOT_DIR=/home/jonesn/opt/openssl -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=/home/jonesn/usr/local`
* build with cmake
* Observe: output file is build/lib/liboqs.a - this is the default build target 

3. Attempt to build provider
* Use same cmake options as in step 2
* Also set `-D-Dliboqs_DIR=/home/jonesn/src/liboqs/build`

Configuration fails 
```
[proc] Executing command: /usr/bin/cmake --no-warn-unused-cli -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Debug -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=/home/jonesn/usr/local -DOPENSSL_ROOT_DIR=/home/jonesn/opt/openssl -Dliboqs_DIR=/home/jonesn/src/liboqs/build/src -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE:STRING=Debug -DCMAKE_EXPORT_COMPILE_COMMANDS:BOOL=TRUE -DCMAKE_C_COMPILER:FILEPATH=/usr/bin/clang -DCMAKE_CXX_COMPILER:FILEPATH=/usr/bin/clang++ -S/home/jonesn/src/oqs-provider -B/home/jonesn/src/oqs-provider/_build -G "Unix Makefiles"
....
[cmake] CMake Error at /home/jonesn/src/liboqs/build/src/liboqsConfig.cmake:29 (include):
[cmake]   include could not find requested file:
[cmake] 
[cmake]     /home/jonesn/src/liboqs/build/src/liboqsTargets.cmake
```
This file is actually in `./liboqs/build/src/cmake/liboqsTargets.cmake` ie the cmake subdirectory

the source line from liboqs is 
```
include("${CMAKE_CURRENT_LIST_DIR}/liboqsTargets.cmake")
```
so I presume something isn't quite right with the context in which this is run

**Expected behavior**
Ability to build liboqs, openssl, oqs_provider all from source

**Screenshots**
none

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Fedora 39
 - OpenSSL version: 3.2.0-alpha2-dev
 - oqsprovider version: main (HEAD @ 6d1ce1862b83cf73bcf410132a2c0699e962177b )

Please run the following commands to obtain the version information:
 - For OpenSSL: `openssl version` -> see above
 - For oqsprovider: `openssl list -providers` -> not build


**Additional context**
The build instructions are not used verbatim - but the configuration documents & steps for configuring and building for each product have been used- I am trying to get the build working within vscode to provide myself with a smoother dev environment & share with colleagues - and community if useful. 


**Hints**

comment.body:
Several observations:

1) Did you run `cmake --install` for `liboqs` or only build? That would explain why the lib is not winding up in the spec'd "CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX"

2) Is '-D-Dliboqs_DIR=/home/jonesn/src/liboqs/build' a typo? Double "-D" will cause problems. Also, please try setting this not just as a `cmake` define but also as an environment variable, i.e., as such "export liboqs_DIR=/home/jonesn/src/liboqs/build" (or whatever install prefix you want for `liboqs`). The way `cmake` honours this is a bit beyond my understanding -- and Fedora/RHEL seem to be particularly "picky". Tagging your colleagues @bhess @beldmit for assistance with this environment.

comment.body:
@thb-sb The issue with the cmake files from liboqs are :

➜  liboqs git:(main) find . -name liboqsConfig.cmake                                                                                        git:(main|) 
./build/src/liboqsConfig.cmake
➜  liboqs git:(main) find . -name liboqsTargets.cmake                                                                                       git:(main|) 
./build/src/CMakeFiles/Export/8aa5f49adc8abed80015a916ce81e944/liboqsTargets.cmake
./build/src/cmake/liboqsTargets.cmake
➜  liboqs git:(main)                

ie they are in different directories.

I did NOT run the cmake --install -- just the default target for liboqs - I know there was going to be a move away from ninja, though the docs still refer to it. No ninja config files though.. I'll persue this 'install' angle

@baentsch 
1. as above - will persue
2. That was my error pasting into github ;-) command is fine

cmake is new to me too.

Thanks for the tips - I'll look into the install angle  for liboqs and persue where these files should be

> ie they are in different directories.

Those are all build directories -- they are not what is/needs to be installed.

That should resolve most (ideally all :) issues.

issue.title: Environment-specific Classic McEliece constant-time leaks

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working; high priority to fix

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
The testing suite is reporting [potential memory leaks](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/pull/1527#issuecomment-1701305585) ([test_constant_time.txt](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/files/12553409/test_constant_time.txt)) for Classic McEliece which are not documented in the suppression files.

**To Reproduce**
I am unable to reproduce this issue locally. Additionally, these errors aren't being caught by the CI during weekly constant time tests. One might try to reproduce this with following steps:
```
docker run -dti openquantumsafe/ci-ubuntu-focal-x86_64 /bin/bash
docker attach (output of docker run command)
cd
git clone https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs
cd liboqs
mkdir build
cd build
cmake -GNinja -DOQS_OPT_TARGET=generic -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Debug -DOQS_ENABLE_TEST_CONSTANT_TIME=ON ..
ninja
cd ..
SKIP_ALGS='BIKE*,Frodo*,HQC*,Kyber*,NTRU*,stru*,ntru*,LightSaber,Saber,FireSaber,Dilithium*,Falcon*,,SPHINCS*' python3 tests/test_constant_time.py  --verbose
```

Thank you for sharing this issue @bhess! Could you please share information about your environment: 
**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: [e.g. Ubuntu 20]
 - OpenSSL version [e.g., 3.0.2]
 - Compiler version used [e.g., clang 9.0.0]
 - Build variables used [e.g., "-DOQS_ALGS_ENABLED=STD"]
 - liboqs version [e.g. 0.7.2 or main branch]

comment.body: @praveksharma, do we consider this to be resolved?

issue.title: Call Keccak_(X4_)Dispatch with pthread_once
issue.body:
Fixes #1548.

Call Keccak_(X4_)Dispatch using pthread_once to ensure setting of global function pointers is atomic and done only once.

* [x] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  NO
* [x] Does this PR change the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming? Does this PR otherwise change an API? NO

comment.body: @zxjtan will you be continuing to work on this?
